thread.title: Honor V9 and Honor 8 Youth Edition announced in China
thread.title_full: Honor V9 and Honor 8 Youth Edition announced in China

title: Honor V9 and Honor 8 Youth Edition announced in China
text:
Honor V9 and Honor 8 Youth Edition announced in China Honor V9 and Honor 8 Youth Edition announced in China By February 21, 2017 “The Honor V9 flagship sports dual 12MP cameras that can capture 3D images” 
As announced earlier, Honor has unveiled its latest flagship smartphone called the Honor V9 in its home market of China. As suggested by the teasers, the Honor V9 sports two primary cameras on the back. In addition to the V9, the company has also launched the Honor 8 Youth Edition, which was recently introduced in Finland as the Honor 8 Lite. 
The Honor 8’s highlight is its dual 12MP camera setup at the back, which is capable of capturing a 3D model of a subject. The brand claims the V9 is the first smartphone to offer such a 3D imaging technology. For selfies and video calling, the device gets an 8-megapixel front-facing snapper. 
As for the other specs, the Honor V9 gets a metal unibody design and a fingerprint sensor located at its rear. The phone flaunts a 5.7-inch quad-HD display, and is powered by a 2.4GHz Hi-Silicon Kirin 960 octa-core processor, mated to either 4GB of 6GB of RAM. It comes in 64GB and 128GB expandable storage variants. The device offers Android Nougat out of the box, 4G LTE and a 4,000mAh battery. 
Coming to the Honor 8 Youth Edition, the phone offers the same metal and glass design as its predecessor, but misses out a dual rear camera setup. It comes with a 5.2-inch full HD display, an octa-core Hi-Silicon Kirin 655 SoC, 12MP/8MP cameras, 4G, VoLTE, Nougat, a 3,000mAh battery, 3GB and 4GB RAM variants and 32GB, 64GB and 128GB storage models. 
As for the pricing, the Honor V9 4GB / 64GB model is priced at RMB 2,599 (~Rs 25,280), the 6GB / 64GB at RMB 2,999 (~Rs 29,180) and the 6GB / 128GB at RMB 3,499 (~Rs 34,000). The Honor 8 Youth Edition 3GB / 32GB model is being offered for RMB 1,099 (~Rs 10,700), 4GB / 64GB for RMB 1,399 (~Rs 13,600) and 4GB / 128GB for RMB 1,599 (~Rs 15,550). They will go on sale in China on February 28th.
